means: 眺望星星，空想，凝视( stargaze的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The reduction in the number of star visible severely affects stargazing activities.
sentence.Network_cn: 可见恒星数目减少,影响到观赏星星的人.

sentence.Network_en: So take advantage of the moonless skies in the evenings this week, and go stargazing.
sentence.Network_cn: 所以乘这个星期的夜晚没有月亮, 尽情的让自己沉湎于星辰吧.

sentence.Network_en: Centaurs burn this, observing the fumes and flames to refine the results of their stargazing ( OP 27 ).
sentence.Network_cn: 人马用烧鼠尾草产生的火焰和烟雾来提炼他们观星的结果 ( 凤凰社, 第27章 ).

entry.def: Star-gazing is the activity of studying the stars as an astronomer or astrologer.

auth_sentence.content: Spend a night or two in Hilo, taking time to day-hike on Mauna Kea or to drive partway up the mountain for stargazing after dark.
